container.heading: Mopeds, Motor Scooters, and Off-Highway Recreational Vehicles

section.heading: Purpose.
section.text: The purpose of this chapter is to clarify requirements for mopeds, motor scooters, and off-highway recreational vehicles.

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
"Administration" means the Motor Vehicle Administration.
“Eye-protective device” means face shields, goggles, and spectacles as described under COMAR 11.13.05.03.
“Moped” has the meaning stated in Transportation Article, §11-134.1, Annotated Code of Maryland.
“Motor scooter” has the meaning stated in Transportation Article, §11-134.5, Annotated Code of Maryland.
“Off-highway recreational vehicle” has the meaning stated in Transportation Article, §11-140.1, Annotated Code of Maryland.
“Protective headgear” has the meaning stated in COMAR 11.13.05.01B(4).
“Title decal” means a decal issued by the Motor Vehicle Administration, to be applied to a moped, motor scooter, or off-highway recreational vehicle for identification purposes.
Mandatory Titling. An individual who owns a moped or motor scooter shall:
Apply, in a format determined by the Administration, for a title and include on the application:
The vehicle identification number;
A serial number; or
A unique identifying number issued by the Administration; and
Pay the following fees:

For a moped or motor scooter owned by the applicant prior to October 2, 2012, and titled prior to October 2, 2013, a title decal fee as set forth in Transportation Article, §13-106(d)(4)(i), Annotated Code of Maryland; and
For all other mopeds or motor scooters:
A title decal fee as set forth in Transportation Article, §13-106(d)(4)(i), Annotated Code of Maryland;
An excise tax as set forth in Transportation Article, §13-809(a)(2)(iv), Annotated Code of Maryland; and
A title fee as set forth in Transportation Article, §13-802(b)(2), Annotated Code of Maryland.

All mopeds and motor scooters in use on public highways as defined in Transportation Article, §11-127, Annotated Code of Maryland, shall display the title decal on the rear of the vehicle in a visible position.
Title decals may not be transferred to:
Another vehicle; or
A subsequent owner of the same vehicle.
Operators and riders on mopeds and motor scooters shall wear protective headgear and eye-protective devices as set forth under COMAR 11.13.05.02 and .03, respectively.

Operators of mopeds and motor scooters shall carry evidence of the required security in accordance with Transportation Article, §17-103, Annotated Code of Maryland, while operating the moped or motor scooter.
Mandatory Titling. An individual who purchases an off-highway recreational vehicle on or after October 1, 2010, shall:
Apply, in a format determined by the Administration, for a title and include on the application:
The vehicle identification number;
A serial number; or
A unique identifying number issued by the Administration; and
Pay the following fees:
An excise tax as set forth in Transportation Article, §13-809(a)(2)(iv), Annotated Code of Maryland; and
A title fee as set forth in Transportation Article, §13-802(a), Annotated Code of Maryland.

Owners of off-highway recreational vehicles may apply, in a format determined by the Administration, for a title decal and pay a fee as set forth in Transportation Article, §13-106(d)(4)(i), Annotated Code of Maryland.
Title decals may not be transferred to:
Another vehicle; or
A subsequent owner of the same vehicle.

section.heading: Lost or Damaged Title Decal.
section.text: If a title decal becomes lost, stolen, mutilated, or illegible, a substitute title decal shall be issued for a fee, as set forth in Transportation Article, §13-106(d)(4)(i), Annotated Code of Maryland, to the owner of a moped, motor scooter, or off-highway recreational vehicle.
